greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = number of nonzero exponents in the prime-factorization of n which are not primes.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: 720 has the prime-factorization of 2^4 *3^2 *5^1. Two of these exponents, 4 and 1, are not primes. So a(720) = 2.
mathematica: f[n_] := Length @ Select[Last /@ FactorInteger[n], ! PrimeQ[ # ] &];Table[f[n], {n, 110}] (* _Ray Chandler_, Nov 19 2006 *)
program: (PARI) A125070(n) = vecsum(apply(e -> if(isprime(e),0,1), factorint(n)[, 2])); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 07 2017
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Nov 18 2006
